Text.Text: The adventurers from[TAR-gohs] Targos.  Did my heart not so heavily weigh, I would celebrate your coming.  These are grim times, and I do not know if there is anything you can do to help us.  I am[IH-zeh-lor] Iselore of Highmoon.
The[yawn-tee] yuan-ti have been attacking for near a week.  When they realized they could not defeat me while the Heartstone Gem defended me, they started attacking the great oak.

Not yet, but they've cut through at least half a dozen roots near as thick as a tall man stands.  The tree cries out to me, and I can do little to aid it.  What's more, I fear they may have found the Crossroads.

Thousands of years ago, when the great oak was just a divine seed, this plateau in the mountains was covered with trees, plants, and animals for miles.  It was an outpost for the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti, serpent creatures from a dark time in[FAY-roonz] Faerun's ancient history.

The whole world was a jungle - at least that's what the old druids say.  And the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti, they dreamed of ruling that world.  The spot upon which the great oak now sits was - is - a gateway, a crossroads to a distant land.

That is the source of all our trouble - and salvation.  It is the Heartstone Gem, an artifact of awesome powers.  It protects[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar and helps provide our village with warmth.  The[OR-il-eyets] Aurilites and the Legion despise it and everything it stands for.
I know too much.  I wish that I knew them only as adversaries.  I remember them when they were children.  They were raised by Mother[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia in a small hut at the edge of the village.

Mother[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia was a priestess of[il-MAY-tur] Ilmater, the god of suffering.  Thirty years ago, when two demons fought each other in this region of the Spine of the World,[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia ventured forth to help those in distress.

She went to Dragon's Eye, a volcanic mountain, to rescue villagers from the yuan-ti and the demon[Ick-sah-noh-mai] Yxunomei.  After a group of adventurers defeated the creature, Mother[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia disappeared.  No one knew what had become of her.

[eh-GAY-nee-uh]Egenia scoured the Spine of the World for both victims and survivors.  She buried the victims at[RAHTH-garz] Hrothgar's Glen.  One dead woman, she took pity on.  An elf maiden named[il-MAH-dee-ah BAH-ree-el] Ilmadia Bariel.

Not even I know why[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia decided to call Ilmadia[il-MAH-dee-ah] back from the spirit world.  The elf had been a lieutenant in the demon[BEL-hee-fets] Belhifet's army.  She was obsessed with rebuilding the Severed Hand, a ruined elven fortress.
When[il-MAH-dee-ah] Ilmadia was revived, she was heartbroken.  Her dreams would never be fulfilled, and she had turned away from the basic moral and ethical values for which elves are admired.

It was not until a month later that[il-MAH-dee-ah] Ilmadia and[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia made a strange discovery.  The elf maiden had a womb filled with life.[eh-GAY-nee-uh]  Egenia believed that[il-MAH-dee-ah] Ilmadia had been blessed by[il-MAY-tur] Ilmater for her turn from evil.  She could not have been farther from the truth.

[il-MAH-dee-ah]Ilmadia gave birth to[CAM-bee-uhns] cambions - half demon, half elf.  Somehow, the demon[BEL-hee-fet] Belhifet had planted a black seed in her womb.  [il-MAH-dee-ah]Ilmadia saw her son with twisted legs, her daughter with a hideous tail.
It was too much for her - everything.[il-MAH-dee-ah]  Ilmadia ran from the house and threw herself over the cliff face.  Her body was never recovered.[eh-GAY-nee-uh]  Egenia never recovered.

She felt responsible for[il-MAH-dee-ah] Ilmadia's death, and she took on the burden of raising the children.  It was around this time that I arrived in the village and found the villagers killing the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti half-breeds that had been born throughout the town.

During all of the troubles, the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti serving the demon[Ick-sah-noh-mai] Yxunomei had captured and... seeded the female villagers of[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar.  Nine months after their rescue, the women of[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar began giving birth.
The children were all girls, all with black hair, smooth green skin, and golden serpent's eyes.  The men of[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar were uncontrollable in their anger, terrible in their fury.

When the church of[il-MAY-tur] Ilmater attempted to intervene, they were run out of town.  That's why the church stands empty to this day.  The mothers carried their children to the only place that would welcome them.  Dragon's Eye.

After I arrived in[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar, I found the town in an uproar.  The villagers were planning to storm Dragon's Eye to kill the... "abominations" - their former wives and daughters, sisters and mothers.

I dissuaded the villagers from such insanity.  It was a year later that I discovered Mother[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia was raising the children in secret at the outskirts of the village.  I did not know what to do.

"They are forged from evil, and nothing but evil can come from them!"  I remember telling her that.  Did we make it so?  I cannot help but wonder now.[eh-GAY-nee-uh]  Egenia believed with all her heart that the[CAM-bee-uhns] cambions could be good and virtuous creatures.

She asked me to name them, since I was raised among elves with an elven father.  The boy was[ih-ZAIR] Isair, the girl,[mah-DAY] Madae.  I named them for my parents, my beloved parents.  I rue the day I made that mistake.

[eh-GAY-nee-uh]Egenia raised the children away from other people, teaching them morality in a bottle.  She groomed[mah-DAY] Madae to be a priestess of[il-MAY-tur] Ilmater.  When old[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia died - that's how the villagers encountered them. [mah-DAY]  Madae was performing burial rites.

The villagers assumed the "monsters" before them had killed the old woman.  When the villagers became agitated,[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia's bottle of morality shattered.[ih-ZAIR]  Isair and[mah-DAY] Madae's demonic instincts took over.

When I arrived, it was a scene of horror.  The villagers never stood a chance.  I tried to contain the twins, but... they escaped into the mountains.  It wasn't until years later that I learned what had become of them.
[ih-ZAIR]Isair and[mah-DAY] Madae lived on the streets of [LUH-skin]Luskan, scraping together money through intimidation and confidence games.  Eventually, the pair tried to dazzle the wrong person.
The intended victim was[ed-GEEL] Edgeel, a master in the Hosttower of the Arcane Brotherhood, a group whose members you've already met.
[ed-GEEL]Edgeel took an interest in the twins for their obvious infernal heritage.  He decided to use the twins as servants and killers in exchange for protection and training in the Art.
The twins proved to be valuable assets to the Hosttower.  Eventually, the brotherhood used[ih-ZAIR] Isair and [mah-DAY]Madae as emissaries to the abyssal planes.
After years of service to the Hosttower, the twins decided to see how they would fare as mercenaries in the Blood War, the eternal battle between the Nine Hells and the Abyss.

The twins worked as mercenaries in the Blood War.  After meeting their father, [BEL-hee-fet]Belhifet, they attempted to become powers of their own among the[bay-AH-teh-zoo] baatezu, the devilish hierarchy of the Nine Hells.

To their dismay, they found they fit in even less among the[bay-AH-teh-zoo] baatezu devils than they did in this world.  Constantly treated as pawns, and frequently manipulated by their father, the twins left the Hells and returned to[FAY-roon] Faerun.
I do not know how they came to live in the Severed Hand, but everything that[eh-GAY-nee-uh] Egenia ever hoped to see become of[ih-ZAIR] Isair and[mah-DAY] Madae died after she passed from this world.

[ih-ZAIR]Isair is a twisted sorcerer with as much power as any master of the Hosttower.[mah-DAY]  Madae, once raised to revere[il-MAY-tur] Ilmater, has become a vile priestess of[ee-YAK-too ZVIHM] Iyachtu Xvim, the hateful bastard son of the Black Lord, Bane.
Now, they seek to establish themselves as a power in the north, with their Legion allies dragged from the most immoral and unreasonable dregs of the world's outcasts.

An insult.[ih-ZAIR]  Isair and[mah-DAYZ] Madae's "Legion of the[kai-MEHR-ah] Chimera" sent emissaries to the cities of the north to announce their sovereign rule of the Spine of the World and their desire for equal commerce.
Most of the emissaries were regarded as freaks and madmen.  The mayor of[BURN SHAN-dehr] Bryn Shander, though... he sent gifts back to[ih-ZAIR] Isair and Madae[mah-DAY].

A bottle of wine and some pastries... all filled with holy water.  The mayor's priest of Helm thought it would be... amusing... to send those gifts after he divined the twins' infernal heritage.[ih-ZAIR]  Isair did not find it endearing.
I have my suspicions, but I cannot confirm them without leaving the Heartstone Gem.  While I believe the Crossroads to be open, it would be unwise to take that risk.
To a jungle, a jungle so far south of here it would take months to journey there by foot.  It is a land called[chult] Chult, far different from the frozen landscape of the Spine of the World.

You must find where the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti have chopped into the great oak.  At one of those places, you should find a gateway to the jungle of[chult] Chult.  Go there, and either defeat all of the[yawn-tee] yuan-ti or seal the portal by slaying its Guardian.

Aye.  All Crossroads have a Guardian, a living creature that serves as its keeper.  Who or what the Guardian of this Crossroads is, I do not know.  Its absence is probably the[yawn-teez] yuan-ti's doing.
What would you like to discuss?
Ah.  You return.  Thankfully, no more[yawn-tee] yuan-ti have approached since your last visit.  I do not know how much longer we could hold them off.
I am glad to see you in reasonably good health.  Tell me, have you sealed the Crossroads?
You have done it.  The Crossroads are not sealed but... did you simply defeat them by force of arms?

I am eternally grateful to you.  I sensed the sealing of the Crossroads and the death of its Guardian.  The[yawn-tee] yuan-ti will be unable to gather reinforcements now.  If you defeat the Legion of the[kai-MEHR-ah] Chimera, peace will return to the land.

As[mah-DAY] Madae made clear, the Legion advances its forces up through Dragon's Eye.  The eruptions years ago must have opened passageways through the mountain.  The base of the volcano sits on the edge of the Fields of Slaughter.
I welcome you back, heroes of[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar.  How may I be of assistance?

[SED-rah]Cedra.  Many times have I urged the people of[KUHL-duh-har] Kuldahar to leave you and your sisters in peace.  This is how you repay us?  And[mah-DAY] Madae - I wish we did not have to meet again under these circumstances.  How did you arrive here?
Step away!  If you attempt to take the Heartstone Gem, you will pay with your lives.  And for what?  The right to bully those who angered you in the past?

I, too, am a half-breed!  When people scoff at me for my mixed blood, I ignore them, I do not stoop to their level.  You cannot force people to accept you,[mah-DAY] Madae.  What you are doing is *wrong.*

I can see there is no reasoning with you,[mah-DAY] Madae.  You and your brother are lost.  Bring on your worst.  I will not stray from this circle until you throw my corpse into the depths of the valley below!

Iselore's eyes glow with the same light of the gem that hangs suspended between the stones.  Although he does not speak, you somehow know he is concentrating on defending Kuldahar from Cedra and her forces, and will not speak again until the enemies threatening the gem are defeated.
What's happening here?
What is that glowing green gem in the center of the standing stones?
What do you know about Isair and Madae?
Do you know why the Legion of the Chimera has been attacking Icewind Dale?
How can we get to the Severed Hand from here?
Can you heal us?
Farewell.
Did they destroy it?
What are the Crossroads?
This area was a jungle?
Where do the Crossroads lead?
We need to get to the Severed Hand.  How can we help you so you can help us?
What is that glowing green gem in the center of the standing stones?
What do you know about Isair and Madae?
Tell me what happened after Ilmadia was revived.
Tell me what happened to Egenia after Ilmadia's children were born.
Tell me more about the yuan-ti half-breeds in Dragon's Eye.
Tell me what happened to Isair and Madae after you arrived.
Tell me about what happened to Isair and Madae after they left Kuldahar.
Tell me about Isair and Madae's involvement in the Blood War.
Do you know why the Legion of the Chimera has been attacking Icewind Dale?
How can we get to the Severed Hand from here?
How can we get to the Severed Hand from here?
Can you heal us?
Farewell.

Yes.  We decided that was the best course of action.  Now, can you tell us how to get to the Severed Hand?
We did not intend to, but that is what happened, yes.  Now, can you tell us how to get to the Severed Hand?
We are glad we could help.  Now, can you tell us how to get to the Severed Hand?
Sure.  Now, can you tell us how to get to the Severed Hand?
We will look for Dragon's Eye on our map.  Can you help us with something else?
We will look for Dragon's Eye on our map.  Farewell.
